name: Cultural Arts Summer Camp
description: Campers spend the day learning Capoeira and maculelê movements; learning about the Capoeira instruments and rhythms; singing songs in Portuguese; and playing Capoeira-based games that accentuate team building, leadership, and cooperation. Weekly activities included: Capoeira, maculelê dance, samba, yoga, stretch, writing, reading, artwork.
fullDescription: Campers spend the day learning Capoeira and maculelê movements; learning about the Capoeira instruments and rhythms; singing songs in Portuguese; and playing Capoeira-based games that accentuate team building, leadership, and cooperation. Weekly activities included: Capoeira, maculelê dance, samba, yoga, stretch, writing, reading, artwork.
whatTheyOffer: Campers spend the day learning Capoeira and maculelê movements; learning about the Capoeira instruments and rhythms; singing songs in Portuguese; and playing Capoeira-based games that accentuate team building, leadership, and cooperation. Weekly activities included: Capoeira, maculelê dance, samba, yoga, stretch, writing, reading, artwork.
howToGetIt: 1. For Elementary School (K-5) enrollment visit and create an account on https://www.abada.org/youth-teen/. Parents must create a profile for themselves and the youth student. Once signed up, parents can request free or reduced-cost access on the mandatory release form. Once the form is signed, parents will be contacted via e-mail to complete enrollment steps. 2. For Teens (13-18), complete enrollment on https://www.abada.org/ray-project/ page and follow the same steps as outlined in 1. Any teen can take Teen/Adult Capoiera free of charge all year long.
cost: Cost may vary based on pre-approved request by parents
